divest.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if a company divests, it sells some of its assets, investments etc
divest.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: pressure on hospitals to divest tobacco-related stocks
divest.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if a group divests one of the companies that it owns, it gets rid of it by selling it
divest.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: We fulfilled our commitment to shareholders to divest our downstream business by creating a new company.
divest.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if a company divests assets, it sells them, for example because it needs cash for another activity or to repay debts
divest.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Where our competitive position is weak, we have continued to divest assets to help fund more profitable ventures elsewhere.
divest.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to reduce the number of your investments by selling some of them
divest.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: performance reports which may signal that it is time to divest rather than invest
